pullRequest.title: Fix exception catch at synthetic handler
pullRequest.bodyText:
Keep the decompilation stack sane when re-throwing from the synthetic
handler.
The code is less than ideal in that it expressly targets the only two kinds
of exceptions that can be thrown from today's synthetic handlers, but
the more general fix will be complex (so better done seperately).
Related: #9267 #9368
[ci skip]
Signed-off-by: Graham Chapman graham_chapman@ca.ibm.com

commit.message:
Fix exception catch at synthetic handler

Keep the decompilation stack sane when re-throwing from the synthetic
handler.

The code is less than ideal in that expressly targets the only two kinds
of exceptions that can be thrown from today's synthetic handlers, but
the more general fix will be complex (so better done seperately).

Related: #9267 #9368

[ci skip]

Signed-off-by: Graham Chapman <graham_chapman@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText:
I see the code to check the decomp stack in jswalk[1] but shouldn't this be modifying the PC here and was having trouble finding the code that treated the returnAddress as the walkState->pc.  Found it now [2].
Do we use this pattern elsewhere as well?  Or is this the first time we're taking advantage of the way jswalk works in this way?
[1] https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/blob/957a07826573fa58672a2e5a6735f7051b91be63/runtime/codert_vm/jswalk.c#L1418-L1424
[2] https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/blob/957a07826573fa58672a2e5a6735f7051b91be63/runtime/codert_vm/jswalk.c#L341
